Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay so I need to figure out which of these cases are violating the normative process described Lets start by understanding what the normative process says

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First the process starts with Receive order then moves to Check inventory After that depending on whether theres enough stock or not it branches into two paths If theres sufficient inventory they should do Authorize Payment Package items Ship order Close order If not they go Cancel order Close order

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The key constraints are 8 Authorize payment only after Check Inventory and before Packaging 9 Package items comes after authorization and before shipping 10 Ship order is after packaging and never after cancellation 11 Close order must be the final step in all cases

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 1 The activities go Receive Check Authorize Package Ship Close This follows the sufficient inventory path perfectly so no violation here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Activities are Receive Check Package items Authorize payment Ship Close Hmm packaging happens before authorization Thats a problem because according to the rules authorize should come before package So this violates the order They packaged without authorizing payment first Also shipping after that would be okay if they had authorized properly but since packaging was done out of order its a violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Receive Check Authorize Cancel Ship Close Wait here they canceled the order but then shipped afterwards The normative process says once you cancel you shouldnt ship because cancellation implies insufficient inventory and no fulfillment steps should follow So shipping after cancel is definitely a violation Also why authorize payment if they are going to cancel That seems odd Maybe even authorizing before knowing inventory was sufficient or not

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 4 Receive Check Cancel Close Perfect for the insufficient path No issues here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Receive Check Authorize Ship Close Wait wheres Package items The process requires that after authorization you package then ship Skipping packaging and going straight to shipping is a violation because packaging is required before shipping Also no mention of canceling or insufficient inventory here maybe the inventory was sufficient but they skipped steps

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So summarizing Case 2 Packaging before Authorization violation Case 3 Shipping after Cancel violation also maybe authorizing payment despite cancellation Case 5 Missing Package items between Authorize and Ship violation
